marketNews.title: US President Trump Extends China Tariff Pause to 10 November 2025
marketNews.content: President of the United States, Donald Trump, on Monday (11/8) extended the pause on the implementation of tariffs on goods originating from China for 90 days until 10 November 2025, a move that could ease concerns over a tariff war and give both countries more time to negotiate further. Previously, in June 2025, China and the United States had reached a trade framework agreement. Bloomberg reported that if Trump does not extend the pause, tariffs on Chinese goods to the United States would rise by at least 54% on Tuesday (12/8) early morning local time.

marketNews.title: PT Phintraco Sekuritas Becomes First Licensed Equity Liquidity Provider
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) announced on Monday (11/8) that PT Phintraco Sekuritas became the first exchange member to officially obtain a license to act as a liquidity provider for equities. Earlier, in May 2025 BEI had released two new regulations that form the legal basis for the implementation of liquidity provider activities to improve market depth and quality.

marketNews.title: Agrinas Pangan Nusantara CEO Resigns Over Lack of Government Funding
marketNews.content: The Chief Executive Officer of PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara, Joao Angelo de Sousa Mota, resigned on Monday (11/8) after only six months in the role, citing that the company had not received government funding. Mota also highlighted that Danantara’s bureaucracy was cumbersome and hampered progress. In response, Danantara CEO Rosan Roeslani told Antara that the company applies strict good corporate governance, with every corporate action taken after comprehensive feasibility studies and a cautious approach to support sustainable performance and stakeholder trust. PT Agrinas Pangan Nusantara was created to oversee a large-scale food grain development and integrated supply-chain project, according to a Bloomberg report.

marketNews.title: CBRE Signs USD 100 Million Pipe-Laying Vessel Purchase
marketNews.content: Cakra Buana Resources Energi (CBRE) signed an agreement to purchase a pipe-laying and lifting vessel for USD 100 million (approximately IDR 1.6 trillion). Funding for the transaction will come from the company’s cash and third-party or bank financing. The deal is intended to diversify the company’s business portfolio into the offshore support vessel (OSV) segment, which previously focused on dry-bulk vessels.

marketNews.title: 7 Books to Raise Your Investment Analysis Level
marketNews.content: Seven books are recommended to elevate your investment analysis, with the note that the books not only add knowledge but also shape thinking and improve the quality of investment decision-making, as quoted by parahitairawan on Stockbit.

tickerNews.title: Bel S.A. Acquires 22.5% of KEJU for IDR 709 billion
tickerNews.content: Bel S.A., a French company, bought approximately 1.3 billion shares of Mulia Boga Raya (KEJU) at an average price of IDR 560 per share on 8 August 2025, 12.5% below the day-close price of IDR 640. The transaction, valued at roughly IDR 709 billion, raised Bel S.A.’s ownership in KEJU from zero to 22.5%. The deal follows GOOD’s announcement of a framework to cooperate with Bel S.A. to jointly control KEJU. GOOD previously held a 66.07% stake in KEJU at the end of July 2025. The partnership aims to develop KEJU’s business by leveraging Bel S.A.’s 150-year-old cheese expertise and brands such as The Laughing Cow and Kiri. In 1H25, KEJU posted a 37% YoY net-profit increase (vs. 1H24 +85% YoY) and revenue up 12% YoY (vs. 1H24 +28% YoY). The KEJU share price rose 16% on Tuesday (12/8) after the transaction announcement, after a correction on Friday (7/8) when the framework was first disclosed.

tickerNews.title: ASII 7M25: Wholesale Vehicle Sales Down 15% YoY, Market Share Declines
tickerNews.content: $ASII: Astra International reported wholesale vehicle sales of 31,772 units in July 2025 (-27% YoY, +8% MoM). This resulted in 7-month (Jan-Jul) wholesale volume of 233,405 units (-15% YoY) with market share falling to 53.6% (vs. 56.9% in 7M24).

tickerNews.title: KRYA Plans Rights Issue and 51% Stake in PT Green City Traffic
tickerNews.content: $KRYA: The business news outlet reported that Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya plans a rights issue targeting IDR 200-300 billion. CEO William Teng said the capital raise will fund ECGO’s 2026 expansion, targeting 55,000 electric-motor units. Earlier this week KRYA announced a capital participation in PT Green City Traffic worth about IDR 10.4 billion, raising KRYA’s stake in the company to 51%.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Wins US$20 Billion FEED Contract for Inpex Masela LNG Project
tickerNews.content: $ADHI: Adhi Karya announced it has received the Letter of Award for a front-end engineering design (FEED) contract on Inpex’s Masela LNG project, valued at US $20 billion. The project will be executed by ADHI in a joint-venture with KBR and Samsung E&A. The contract value was not disclosed by ADHI.

tickerNews.title: PT PP Secures IDR 11.8 Trillion of New Contracts in 7M25
tickerNews.content: $PTPP: PT PP recorded new contract value of approximately IDR 11.8 trillion in 7M25 (-10% YoY), equal to 41.4% of the 2025 target of IDR 28.5 trillion. New contracts were 42% private-sector, 39% state-owned, and 19% government.

tickerNews.title: PPRI: Commissioner Irsyad Hanif Increases Stake to 17.94%
tickerNews.content: $PPRI: Commissioner Irsyad Hanif (also a director of GULA) bought 50 million PPRI shares at an average price of IDR 211 per share on 8 August 2025, a transaction worth about IDR 10.6 billion. After the purchase, his direct stake rose from 15.61% to 17.94%. Earlier, on 7 August 2025 he bought 140 million shares at an average of IDR 50 per share.

tickerNews.title: CBRE to Acquire Pipe-Laying Vessel for US $100 Million
tickerNews.content: $CBRE: Cakra Buana Resources Energi signed an agreement to purchase a pipe-laying and lifting vessel for US $100 million (≈IDR 1.6 trillion). Funding will come from the company’s cash and third-party or bank financing, and the deal aims to diversify the company’s portfolio into offshore support vessels, moving beyond its current dry-bulk fleet.
